benchmark_details.name: DA-Code: Agent Data Science Code Generation Benchmark
benchmark_details.overview: DA-Code is a code generation benchmark specifically designed to assess LLMs on agent-based data science tasks, featuring challenging tasks sourced from diverse real-world data, requiring the use of complex data science programming languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the code generation capabilities of large language models in complex data science tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The performance of existing LLMs is modest, achieving approximately 30.5% accuracy, indicating significant room for improvement.

data.source: Real-world data sources from Kaggle, GitHub, and other platforms
data.annotation: Carefully designed tasks by experienced annotators

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on performance benchmarks established within the evaluation suite.
methodology.interpretation: Scores represent the effectiveness of LLM agents in completing the designated coding tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: DA-Agent baseline achieves a performance score of 30.5% on average.
methodology.validation: Cross-validation and red team testing ensure robustness of evaluations.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of performance across different tasks and models is underway to explore demographic impacts.
